net.coderazzi.filters.parser.generic
Class OperandFactory

java.lang.Object
  net.coderazzi.filters.parser.generic.OperandFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
IRelationalOperandFactory
public class OperandFactory
extends Object
implements IRelationalOperandFactory

Default IRelationalOperandFactory implementation

List of supported operands:

  • Basic ones:
    • >
    • <
    • >=
    • <=
    • =
    • != : the same as <>
    • <> : the same as !=
  • Case insensitive operators: work on the stringfied representation of the objects
    • >@
    • <@
    • >=@
    • <=@
    • =@
    • !=@
    • <>@
  • 'Regular expression ones': works on strings only. The regular expressions are simplified: only characters * ? are supported
    • ~ : For example, 'a~A*B' returns true if the expression a starts with A upper case and ends with B
    • !~ : negation of the previous operator
    • ~@ : insensitive case of the basic operator; For example, 'a~A*B' returns true if the expression a starts with A or a and ends with B or b
    • !~@ : negation of the previous operator

    • Author:
    Luis M Pena - dr.lu@coderazzi.net

                                     int index)
    Description copied from interface: IRelationalOperandFactory
    Returns the operand that exists at the beginning of the substring all[index:]

    Specified by:
    getOperand in interface IRelationalOperandFactory
    Parameters:
    c - the character at all[index]
    all - the whole string
    index - the position to start parsing
    Returns:
    null if the given position does not define a valid operand

    getDefaultOperand

    public IRelationalOperand getDefaultOperand(Class<?> c,
                                            boolean nullOp,
                                            boolean rightId)
    The default implementation returns the EQUAL THAN operand for all types except String, and the regular expression based EQUAL THAN for strings.

    Specified by:
    getDefaultOperand in interface IRelationalOperandFactory
    Parameters:
    c - the type's class
    nullOp - true if the value to be associated to the operand is the null instance.
    rightId - true if the comparison is against a second identifier
    See Also:
    IRelationalOperandFactory.getDefaultOperand(Class, boolean, boolean)

    setComparator

    public void setComparator(Class<?> c,
                          Comparator<?> cmp)
    Description copied from interface: IRelationalOperandFactory
    Defines a comparator for a given class. This comparator must be propagated to the operands, to modify their behaviour when comparating objects of this class.

    Specified by:
    setComparator in interface IRelationalOperandFactory
    See Also:
    IRelationalOperandFactory.setComparator(Class, Comparator)

    setIgnoreCase

    public void setIgnoreCase(boolean ignore)
    Description copied from interface: IRelationalOperandFactory
    Defines whether the created operand should be case insensitive. This comparator must be propagated to the operands, to modify their behaviour when comparating string objects.

    Specified by:
    setIgnoreCase in interface IRelationalOperandFactory
    See Also:
    IRelationalOperandFactory.setIgnoreCase(boolean)
